content.title: Intro
content.content:
1931
Preceded by
1931
1932
Year
1933
Followed by
1933

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1932.

content.title: April
content.content:
8 - C.S. Lewis recommends his brother Warren in a letter to read J.R.R. Tolkien's translation of The Owl and the Nightingale.
27 - Voice actor Casey Kasem is born.

content.title: May
content.content:
? - The British Esperantist (Vol.28), including J.R.R. Tolkien's "A Philologist on Esperanto", is published.
24 - R.W. Chambers sends J.R.R. Tolkien an inscribed copy of Beowulf: An Introduction to the Study of the Poem.
27 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to A.F. Colborn.

content.title: June
content.content:
12 - Actor Michael Elsworth is born.
22 - Voice actress Prunella Scales is born.

content.title: July
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien's essay "The Name 'Nodens'" is published as an appendix to the Report on the Excavation of the Prehistoric, Roman, and Post-Roman Site in Lydney Park, Gloucestershire.

content.title: August
content.content: 9 - Voice actor Denys Hawthorne is born.

content.title: November
content.content: 30 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.

content.title: December
content.content:
9 - Author Jan Broberg, who were to conduct an interview with J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.
23 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.
? - Tolkien's essay Sigelwara Land (Part 1) is published.
Years
1929 1930 1931 1932 1933 1934 1935
